heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5244 lux), cloud levels (up 348 m), and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 21.0m lower than yesterday, 33.2m lower than the past week, 348.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1043m minimum and 1366m maximum, with an average of 1213.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1247.1m and 1562.1m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and periods of sunshine are expected. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (86%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
